title: Senate Passes Bill to Reopen Government Amid Democratic Rift
summary: The vote, on Day 41 of the shutdown, signaled an end in sight to weeks of gridlock. Eight members of the Democratic Caucus supplied the critical backing.

title: Shutdown Deal Revives Democratic Infighting
summary: The agreement prompted a backlash within the party, not only against the Democratic defectors who supported it, but against Senator Chuck Schumer, the leader who did not.

title: For Trump, Nothing Was Off Limits During the Shutdown
summary: President Trump pressured Democrats by taking punishing actions no previous administration ever took during a shutdown.

title: As Iraqis Vote for a Parliament, U.S. Presses to Rid Country of Iran’s Influence
summary: After a U.S. occupation, years of sectarian violence and a jihadist insurgency, Iraq has become an improbable haven of calm in the Middle East.

title: Iraqis Are Voting for a New Parliament. Here’s What to Know.
summary: Iraq is caught in the conflict between Washington and Tehran, with the Trump administration insisting that the next government disarm powerful Iran-backed militias.

title: Syria’s President Meets Trump at White House for First Time
summary: The visit by President Ahmed al-Shara is another step in the transformation of the former rebel leader once wanted by the United States as a terrorist.

title: How Syria’s President Transformed His Image
summary: Syrian President Ahmed al-Shara’s meeting with President Trump in Washington signifies a new turn for al-Shara, a former Islamist rebel leader who was once designated by the United States as a terrorist with a $10 million bounty on his head. Our reporter Christina Goldbaum describes the meeting.

title: Trump Pardons the Husband of a Republican Congressional Ally
summary: Robert Harshbarger Jr. pleaded guilty in 2013 to health care fraud and distributing a misbranded drug. His wife, Diana Harshbarger, is a member of Congress.

title: Dismantled by DOGE, a Foreign Policy Center Finds New Life
summary: The Kennan Institute, which researches Russia and the surrounding region, has re-emerged in a form that is smaller but more impervious to government control.

title: Marriage Ruling Relieves Gay Americans and Leaves Conservatives Pledging New Challenges
summary: The Supreme Court chose not to revisit a case involving same-sex marriage. The number of married same-sex couples has doubled in the last 10 years.

title: Trump Asks Supreme Court to Overturn Verdict in E. Jean Carroll Case
summary: The president said the assertions behind a judgment that he sexually abused and defamed the writer were “implausible” and “unsubstantiated.”

title: 2025 Booker Prize Goes to David Szalay’s ‘Flesh’
summary: The rags-to-riches tale had already made fans of Zadie Smith and Dua Lipa. Roddy Doyle, who chaired the judging panel, called the book “singular” and “extraordinary.”

title: Why the BBC Is Facing Its Gravest Crisis in Decades
summary: The British public service broadcaster apologized on Monday for a misleadingly edited documentary about President Trump. But the scandal had already claimed two of its top executives.

title: F.D.A. Will Remove Black Box Warnings From Hormone Treatments for Menopause
summary: The benefits of hormone replacement have been underappreciated, Dr. Marty Makary, the agency’s commissioner, said on Monday. Critics described evidence for the change as insufficient.

title: Book Review: ‘Unfettered,’ by John Fetterman
summary: The senator from Pennsylvania chronicles his stroke, unlikely election victory and battle with depression. Just don’t expect him to try to win you over.

title: Chi Ossé Plans to Challenge Jeffries, Despite Mamdani’s Opposition
summary: Chi Ossé, a New York City councilman, has told allies he is preparing to challenge Representative Hakeem Jeffries, the Democratic leader of the House.

title: How Did Mamdani Reach Young Male Voters? Podcasts and YouTube Shows.
summary: Zohran Mamdani navigated a media landscape similar to the one that helped Trump win over young men.

title: Families of Children Killed in Texas Floods Sue Camp Mystic, Claiming Gross Negligence
summary: Parents of campers and counselors who died in the July 4 Texas floods said the camp leadership did little before mounting “a hopeless ‘rescue’ effort from its self-created disaster.”

title: The 20-Somethings Who Raised $121 Million to Build Military Drones
summary: Neros, a company founded in 2023 by former teenage drone racers, won a coveted Army contract and is gaining popularity in the defense sector.

title: Alex Karp Went From Biden Donor to Trump Enabler. Why?
summary: A tech billionaire professes to hate identity politics, but they seem in some ways to consume him.

title: On Veterans Day, This Is the Lonely, Terrible Sorrow We Must Never Forget
summary: To imagine the cost of an “America First” policy, walk through World War II cemeteries in Europe.

title: How China Reached Into New York to Stop a Tiny Film Festival
summary: A showcase for independent Chinese films was scrapped after the Chinese authorities pressured directors, moderators and even a volunteer to pull out.

title: Mobile Lounge Crashes at Dulles Airport, Causing Injuries and Damage
summary: More than a dozen people were hospitalized after a bus-like vehicle for passengers crashed into a dock at the Washington airport.

title: Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs Could Trim Prison Sentence With Drug Rehab Program
summary: A spokesman for the fallen music mogul, who is serving a four-year sentence for prostitution-related offenses at the Fort Dix prison complex in New Jersey, said he has been accepted to the program.
